alert.note: Alert for Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern York, southern Oxford, southwestern Androscoggin and northwestern Cumberland Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bridgton, moving southeast at 5 mph. Additional strong thunderstorms are expected to develop as several outflow boundaries merge together. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Naples, Gray, Hiram, Cornish, Raymond, Standish, Casco, Limington, Limerick, Harrison, Brownfield, Denmark, Frye Island, New Gloucester, Sebago, Otisfield and Poland. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 64 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Sebago Lake and other lakes across Cumberland, southern Oxford, and Androscoggin counties, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
